text: A mausoleum is a building used to store the remains of people who have died. Instead of being buried in soil, like in a cemetery, they are placed in chambers behind walls, or in a vault under the floor. The word came from the name of an ancient king. == Lenin's Mausoleum == Soviet leader Lenin is a mausoleum. In 1953, Joseph Stalin was buried next to him but his body was removed during destalinization. == Examples == * Sun Yat-sen's Tomb in Nanjing, China * The Taj Mahal * The Great Pyramids * Grant's Tomb Category:Burial monuments and structures
title: Mausoleum
